extendedIngredients.name: grand marnier
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup Grand Marnier (orange juice can be substituted)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey

recipes.title: Rhubarb Coconut Popsicles
recipes.instructions: In a sauté pan combine rhubarb, 1 tablespoon honey, and Grand Marnier; bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes until reduced with only 1 tablespoon of liquid remaining and the rhubarb is soft. Transfer to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth.In a bowl, stir to combine coconut milk and the remaining honey.Pour the rhubarb puree and coconut milk into the popsicle molds in layers (puree, coconut milk, puree, coconut milk). With a spoon or popsicle stick, gently swirl the layers together. Place the top on the popsicle mold and insert popsicle sticks. Freeze for at least 4 hours. Remove the popsicles by briefly running warm water over the mold and gently pulling the popsicles out. Serve. Store popsicles in food-safe plastic bags or wrapped in wax paper in the freezer.

steps.step: In a sauté pan combine rhubarb, 1 tablespoon honey, and Grand Marnier; bring to a boil and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes until reduced with only 1 tablespoon of liquid remaining and the rhubarb is soft.
Transfer to a food processor or blender and puree until smooth.In a bowl, stir to combine coconut milk and the remaining honey.
Pour the rhubarb puree and coconut milk into the popsicle molds in layers (puree, coconut milk, puree, coconut milk). With a spoon or popsicle stick, gently swirl the layers together.
Place the top on the popsicle mold and insert popsicle sticks. Freeze for at least 4 hours.
Remove the popsicles by briefly running warm water over the mold and gently pulling the popsicles out.
Serve. Store popsicles in food-safe plastic bags or wrapped in wax paper in the freezer.
